captions.text: I don't know what you're talking about.
Daisy... you used to do everything with her??
Yea, then she threw us out.
She didn't replace you, her parents did!
and they only replaced you because Daisy
All this time I've been angry, for nothing.
Yeah if anyone should be furious, it should be Big Baby or Chuckles...
they didn't get replaced it all!
They're getting away! Come on, Bullseye!
I'm over here Mr. Potato Head!
I don't think I've ever been more happy than I am with these toys!
Only an idiot would give great toys like these away!

Okay, I change my mind. I love these toys.
You can't have them, I'm taking them all back
I can't believe I almost gave you guys away!
And we've been alive this whole time!!
Your toys are talking, think you've lost you mind..
And you just wrecked your car.....
Mom, I swear the toys came alive!
They're alive! Yes, all of them.
Can we all agree this was a huge mistake?
Uh, why won't anyone believe me??

title: How Toy Story 3 Should Have Ended

comments.text:
The only thing that really bugged me was his getting rid of Woody. From the 
way Andy's mom reacted in Toy Story2 Woody(and for that matter Bullseye) 
could have been a family heirloom, passed down to oldest children and what 
not. I mean, yes it was sweet and all that he had a big enough heart to 
give all his toys away(and I know the toys are all supposed to stay 
together), but I kind of wanted to see them live on through his kids.﻿

comments.author: Sebastian 1HellOfaButler

comments.text:
Why would the toys suddenly come alive in front of Andy? That goes against 
everything about being a toy! The only time they did something like this 
was in the event of a rescue mission to ensure that Sid would leave the 
toys alone. And even then, Woody admitted that this plan would cause them 
to break some rules, so in other words there is in fact a good reason 
behind why they never come alive in front of humans. The Lotso thing on the 
other hand I can fully understand. I mean, the whole reason for him being 
evil is nothing more than a misunderstanding! If someone could've stood up 
to him and explained what really happened back then, maybe he would learn 
the error of his ways and have a change of heart, instead of continually be 
blinded by envy and leave Woody and co to die at the junk yard when he had 
just one chance to make himself become a hero for a change! At least The 
Lego Movie did it right, which I'm very sorry for spoiling if you haven't 
already seen it by now!﻿
